1.content:
Amazonian Tribe - When Fox McCloud is sent on a mission to a primitive planet, he comes across an Amazonian community that forbids men on their lands and gives Fox a makeover he'll never forget.

Marooned - After a dog fight with Star Wolf, Fox makes an emergency landing on an unknown planet. He tries to make contact for his crew, but to no avail. While waiting for his crew to find him, he decides to do a little exploration in the surrounding area, but doing so could various results on his body.

SpaceCase Soda - Fox becomes a taste-tester for a soda company to test out their new formulas of soda since a recall of a recent distribution had strange effects on their customers like muscle mass reduction and the like. Also, the soda strangely enough is for sexual enhancement. Well, the new batch would be fixed of all these problems......right?

Underground Lab - Fox is sent on a mission to investigate an underground lab on Corneria. What will he find and what experiments will await him?
1.title: Choose the Scenario

choices: He gets captured by one of the women
He decides to sneak around the village for clues
11.content:
Fox's solo mission was not so simple. He was to head to a primitive planet, almost similar to Sauria but more jungle like, and search for missing team of scientists. The planet was recently discovered, and a company funded and sent the team there to research and explore the land and of its resources, animals and among other things. However, about a week after their arrival, the researchers have been declared missing since for two days they haven't responded to incoming messages from the company and seem to have lost complete contact. The company then hired Star Fox to get to the bottom of this mystery. Fox decided to make this a solo mission, but request for backup if ever needed of course.

He landed in a clearing right next to the scientists' spaceship which was their base of operations. There were also some vehicles right outside for navigating and exploring the jungle land. The base was also located next to a cave's mouth on a huge mountain. Fox had gotten out of his ship and observed the area which was eerily quiet. He then went into the spaceship only to find empty from top to bottom. Though some of the rooms seemed to be ransacked like a struggle took place or that someone was looking for something. The answers were still unclear. Fox was still baffled about it, and reported it on his communicator to his team.

After thinking about it for awhile, his eyes then look toward the cave. The next place to check which could definitely lead him straight to the answer to this mystery or at least give him a clue to the scientists' whereabouts. He then went into the cave and walked what seemed to be miles further in. Though he did came across interesting things along the way such as what to be cave paintings, indicating that there are some lifeforms with a degree of intelligence inhabiting this planet. Odd about the paintings though is it is mostly women drawn on there. He traveled a bit more for about an hour, and saw some light. Revealing it was more of a natural tunnel than cave then. He came to the other side of the mountain to more jungle, but the canopy was thicker and blocked a lot of sunlight.

Fox traveled through the jungle until he found what looked like a small village. There were some huts or houses made by the trees in the area, and looked to be roughly the size of a two story house. There was a big fire in the center of it that illuminate the place. What shocked him most of all were its residents. They were all women! Anthropomorphic women that were about 7 to 9 feet tall and had little clothing on them! They were cougars, cheetahs, foxes, etc. Fox maintained a safe distance and hid behind in a bush. He then went back to his communicator and told Slippy about his discovery. He looked around if there were any signs of the scientists in the area, but came across something interesting. In a distance, there seemed to be a temple a little ways beyond the village. Fox tried to come up with a plan.

What happens next?
11.title: Amazonian Tribe

113.content:
Fox decided to head towards the temple in the distance. Even from far away, the temple was a sight to behold. It was an immense building, made of what appeared to be marble that looked like it was glowing. There was a series of glowing symbols that had been carved into the temple. Fox had no clue as to what the runes were saying (he doubted even Slippy could figure it out), but he guessed they were just something reminiscent of a warning or a notice or something. Looking around, Fox didn't see much of interest.

"Maybe I can find the scientists here" thought Fox.
113.title: When in doubt, head towards the temple!

114.content: Fox knew he couldn't do this alone. "I'd better call for backup" he thought. He decided to call in...
114.title: Send in backup!

12.content:
He couldn't believe what was happening. Star Wolf along with mercenaries they hired had to ambush them when they were doing their mission on escorting important cargo back to Corneria. The opposing forces managed to fight long and hard, however, both seemed like a stalemate since they took quite a beating. Wolf and his crew pulled back because of their critical condition, and so did Star Fox who managed to keep the cargo safe. Not was all well for Fox though. His Arwing was looked like hell. His right wing were mostly wrecked, his fuel and engine power were starting drop rapidly, and bits and pieces of the ship as a whole were falling off and drifting. Worst yet is that his ship was too damaged that it would be near impossible to make a trip back to the Great Fox. Fortunately, there was a planet nearby, but strange since it seems to be uncharted on the map.

"Slippy, do you read?" However, over the com link, it was mostly static and could barely make anything out, the damage must have affected the communication systems as well. "Crap." He had no choice but to head to the planet. With the last of his fuel supply, he flew to the planet. Another problem was that landing gear was apparently damaged as well so it'll definitely be quite the landing. More problems persist as the ship was beginning to tear up when entering and passing through the atmosphere. Fox just tried his best of stabling and controlling the ship for a safe landing as gained speed from falling. As he neared the surface with a nose dive, he tried to slow it down to reduce the impact. He managed to do that just as he hit the natural floor and skid on the ground for a bit, but it knocked him out due to hitting his head hard on the wheel and control panels.

He awoke with a daze. "Ow, my head...." He moaned. He then took a look of his surroundings discovering that he is in.......

Where was he?
12.title: Marooned

121.content:
He looked around to only to see himself surrounded by an ocean of trees. Some of them being taken down and damaged behind the Arwing when during the crash landing, creating a small clearing with debris.

Looking at the outside from within the ship, he saw damage taken to the Arwing. Both wings had been torn off during atmospheric impact, the exterior burnt and damaged exposing circuitry, instruments including radar in the cockpit and interior lost power, and engines were shot and ruined to the point of nonfunctional. Overall, it was totaled and beyond repair and it was a miracle that he would survived it.

He checked his communicator watch and tried to make contact to his team.

"Slippy? Peppy? Falco? Are you there? Can anybody hear me?" He spoke into the communicator but only received static in response. Great, I'm too out of range. He thought to himself in slight frustration.

Fox opened up the cockpit and hopped onto the soft soil ground. Looking around again, he can hear birds chirping, the trees swaying in the calm breeze, and other natural forest sounds. He looked back at the Arwing in its totaled state and thought that there wasn't any reason in sticking around. It was better to look around to see anything useful nearby, whether it be food or shelter or some kind civilization that can help.

So he started to walk in a random direction, hoping to find something.

What does he eventually find?
121.title: Fox in the Forest

1213.content: What does he eventually find?

After walking through the forest for around an hour, Fox started to grow slightly weary until his ears twitched and picked up a sound. It sounded like heavily running or rushing water.

'A river?' he thought to himself. It sounded nearby, just further eastward. He walked a little faster in the direction of the noise. After awhile he found himself on the bank of long windy river that looked to be nearly 10ft deep and a bit over twice as wide. The waters looked surprisingly pristine and clear, good enough to drink and swim in even, which kinda stuck as options in his mind.

He also thought about walking along the river to see if he can find anymore resources or even civilization. He began to weigh his options.

What does he do?

Fox found himself in a thick jungle. The air was humid, the plants were thick and it looked like there was absolutely no civilization around for miles.

"I'll need to find some food, set up a base camp and try to contact my friends" said Fox. He decided to first...
122.title: It's a jungle out here!

choices: Look at his body to see whats wrong
1221.content:
As Fox was setting up camp a mysterious figure cloaked in black appeared before Fox he was so stunned that all he could come up with was....
"Who are you?" Fox said in a intriguing voice. The figure said nothing but did do something the figure shot a beam of black directly at Fox.

Fox woke up with pain in his groin, his chest, and around his butt, as well as his face now that he thinks about it he felt pain everywhere, so Fox decided to.....
1221.title: Set up base camp.

1222.content:
"*Gurgle....*Groooooowwwl..."

Fox's stomach made its decision that food was first on the list of priorities. Hunting was going to be time consuming and definitely don't want to be searching for something bigger than he as that would be asking for trouble. Looking around the massive trees, the thick bushes, and even flowery spots on the ground, gathering berries, fruit and other edible sources would be the quicker, safer and easier route.

He then started to look for food.

Where does he find food?
1222.title: Find some food.

choices: Fox finds something unusual while searching.
Fox searches for several hours, but finds nothing.
1223.content:
Fox's first order of business was to try getting off of this jungle planet. Presumably, the easiest way to do that was to get another member of the StarFox crew to pick him up. Pressing the corresponding button on the communications console of his Arwing, he wasted no time sending out a distress call.

"StarFox team, do you copy? I'm stranded on an uncharted planet and I need immediate assistance!" Fox waited a moment for a response, then tried again when none came. "StarFox team, do you read? Slippy? Falco? Krystal? Peppy?" The comms didn't even pick up static. All Fox got was total silence.

Grunting in frustration, Fox hopped out of the cockpit and onto the jungle floor. Surveying his damaged spacecraft, it didn't take him long to find a large gash in the side of the hull. He peered inside and saw that part of the communication system had been ripped out of the ship during the crash.

Fox growled. "Great. Who knows how far away the comms system is." No, this wasn't becoming of him. He was the leader of StarFox, and he was going to handle this situation like a proper team leader. Closing his eyes, he slowly inhaled, and then exhaled to cool his head. He opened his eyes and looked around at the crash site. The path of felled trees and uprooted shrubbery wasn't actually that long, maybe two hundred feet at most. Looking again at the gash in the hull, Fox determined that the comms system probably came loose sometime after the initial impact, torn out by a tree or something. If he could just find it, repairs would be a cinch.

"Well," Fox told himself, "it's best if I find the comms system as soon as possible."
1223.title: Radio Silence

12231.content: What does Fox find on his search?
12231.title: Fox finds something unusual while searching.

choices: ...the entire room covered in comfortable-looking rugs and pillows.
122311.content:
As his search for his Arwing's comms system took him further and further away from the crash site, Fox found himself getting progressively more agitated. Since he never saw it fly out of his craft, locating it was mostly a guessing game. Did it get thrown out away from the ship? Did it carry its momentum? Did it cause any damage to the nearby landscape? Now that he thought about it, how could it even still be operational? Reinstalling a functional component of his Arwing was one thing, but fixing an already-broken one was another. If he didn't find it soon, continuing his search would probably just be a waste of time.

Fox's thoughts were interrupted by a strange sight through the trees. Instead of more green leaves and brown bark, he saw something that looked like stone with a dirty yellow color. Between his curious instincts and his weariness of the current scenery, Fox couldn't keep himself from approaching this new find.

Stepping out of the trees and into a small, open clearing, Fox got a good look at what looked like an old, abandoned temple. The structure consisted of a small pyramid--no larger than a townhouse--and a short set of stairs leading into a doorway. The stone was worn, mossy, and covered in places by stray vines and roots. There were no statues, carvings, writing, or paintings to indicate what the structure's purpose was.

"Strange," Fox thought aloud. "Wasn't this planet supposed to be uninhabited?" Mulling over several possibilities for a few moments, he decided to drop the subject. The day's events had left him too irritated and impatient for anything that didn't produce results. Besides, he could look into it all he wanted after he was rescued. "At least I have shelter in case I'm not out of here by sunset," Fox admitted to himself. It wasn't the kind of progress he wanted, but finding this place was still a net positive for him.

Fox climbed the steps and stepped through the temple's entrance. Beyond the doorway, it seemed to extend a short ways underground. A sloping hallway lit by gaps in the ceiling led into a large central chamber that gave Fox an idea about the temple's purpose. In it, he found...
122311.title: Ancient Temple

123.content:
He looked around the area only to see a sea of sand all around him. Definitely in a desert setting.

“Great, of all the places to crash land…” Fox grumbled to himself.

After regaining to his senses completely, he went to assess the damage done to his vessel indicated from the dashboard instruments.

“Landing gear is busted… Communications are down…The thrusters are shot as well as the engine… Battery is nearly out of juice; only 5% power, barely for an hour, meaning that my AC won’t last too long. Crud.”

He then opened the hatch of the Arwing and hopped onto the sandy ground. The change of temperature from the cool cockpit to desert outside was very drastic. It felt like 100 F degrees as Fox started to feel uncomfortable in his spacesuit and jacket and panting.

He looked at the outside damage that reflected what he read previously and more. The wings were clearly broken, the body smelled of burnt metal and black, and back thrusters busted beyond recognition. The combination of the attack and breaking into the planet’s atmosphere had really taken its toll on it.

“What to do now?” he said while he looked up towards the scorching sun with shading his eyes with a hand. He could wait for his teammates to find him, but again not much power in the craft and he’ll definitely get cooked in this heat once it’s out. He rather risked finding shelter and shading quick. But where to go? He looked around again with nothing but sand and dunes in sight.

‘Anywhere better than here, I suppose.’ Fox thought and set off in a random direction.

It was after a long while as he trekked in the vast desert until…
123.title: A Vast Desert

choices: He falls into a hole in the ground
1233.title: Other

choices: He finds a mountain with a cave
12333.title: Mountain Cave?

123331.content:
He traveled in the dry desert heat for nearly an hour until he saw something pointed over the horizon. As he gotten closer, he was able to make out an orange red mountain range with plenty of jagged rocks that stretched as far from the west to east. Getting closer still, he can make out some kind of cave opening at the base. Finally, some shade!

In a tired and weak legged state, he tried his best to quickly get to the cave before he gets cooked well-done from the blazing sun. He pressed on until he reached the mouth of the cave that stood at 10ft height and 10ft width.

Finally, he was out of the sun and into a cool shade. He leaned on the cave wall to take a breather, panting up a storm while letting loose a few coughs here and there as it echoed through the cave. It wasn’t the only thing that made an echo though as his stomach growled soon after. He managed to dodge deadly sunburn, but now he needed to fight off starvation and dehydration.

“Just one problem after another.” He muttered to himself.

He looked into the dark abyss, nothing than pitch black. What kind of things will he encounter in the dark deep? Well, he rather take his chances there than getting cooked outside that’s for sure.

He kept his hand on the wall as a guide and to keep balance as he started to walk farther into the cave. The only noises that accompanied him were his echoing breathing and footsteps along with the howling of the cool breeze. After what felt like half an hour as well as his eyes adjusting to the dark, he came upon another problem.
There was a fork in the path that split into three different passageways: left, middle, and right.

“Great, now where to go?” he said to himself, deciding which path to take.

Which one did he take?
123331.title: Caving into the Mountain

choices: Comes across a section of tunnel with runes covering the walls
1233311.content:
“Well, left it is, I guess.”

He proceeded to walk down the left passageway with his hand still on the wall as a guide and still relying on his adjusted vision in the dark. He did take breaks from time to time to rest his legs and catch his breath though. As he followed the tunnel, he noticed how it seemed to slant slightly downwards. Not to mention it was starting to get a warmer as the cool breeze started to die down a bit, still better than outside in the grueling sun.

It was nearly half an hour of nothing but tunnel and loose rocks until he…
1233311.title: Left path

12333111.content:
He came across a stretch of tunnel that had weird markings etched onto the left and right walls. There were strange runes and small pictures that indicated as some kind of writing and language system. Some of it looked familiar like combined stars, a backwards ‘h’, the female gender symbol, etc. while the rest just looked like a combination of lines, circles, and other shapes that supposed to represent or mean something. It was definitely and obviously unnatural as if created by some kind of ancient tribe that lived nearby the mountain range.

Part of some kind of ritual? Maybe close to written historic events? Its purpose and meaning puzzled him, but still went on his way.
As he went further down the symbol covered tunnel, he saw something strange happening to them that caused him to stop. They started to glow a slightly dim pinkish hue. It caused him to be slightly nervous and cautious.

“What’s happening now?” he said.

Soon, he started to feel…

123331121.content:
He came across a section of tunnel that had strange looking mushrooms littered around the walls, ceiling and the floor. They were twice the size of regular ones and had odd pinkish caps that seemed to illuminate dimly in the darkness. Not enough to light up the entire tunnel or cause eye strain for vision adjustment.

Curiously, Fox plucked one out of the ground and started to examine it, slightly sniffing it. Other than its unusual aspects, it looked like a normal mushroom. The question is that if it is edible or not? And that is it poisonous?

He heard his stomach growl loud with an echo. His hunger pangs were starting to get harder to ignore and star. He could just leave these alone and just go on his way and encounter some other kind of food as he progresses. But whenever will that be? This followed by his stomach protesting with another growl.

He stood there pondering for a while.

What happens next?

1233311221.content:
He came across a naturally made room where he could see another passageway on the other side.

What was in the middle of the room interested and impressed him.

It was a circular pool of crystal clear blue water that looked to be around 5-6ft deep. However, there were some things that were odd. First, when he approached the edge he noticed how pristine and clear the water is as if it were untouched by any living being. Not even a single trace of dirt or debris appeared floating on its surface. Secondly, the pool seemed to reflect some kind of light that dimly lit up the room enough to see at least a few feet from the pool all around but hard to locate this light source within it.

Fox licked his muzzle lips at the sight of the water, wanting to drink it badly to quench his thirst and get hydrated. It even looked good enough to swim in! Definitely it is a good way to relax a bit and wash off the sand, dirt and sweat. However, it does leave him exposed if he does and who knows what lurks in these caves? He could just take a drink and go on his way, but when will he be able to get another chance like this? And again, he can take the time off for his aching legs and feet from all that walking.

What does he do?

125.content:
He had discovered he was on an island. Thank goodness he didn't land in the water, but on the shore. With the com link busted, he tried his the communicator on his watch. "Slippy? Do you copy? Is everyone okay?" The only response he got was just static and nothing more. He just cursed to himself about the whole situation he is in. He had gotten out of his cockpit and took a closer look of his surroundings. The island's shoreline stretched about some miles. There was also a sea cliff nearby with an opening to a cave. In front of him was a vast sea of blue water, and behind him was a tropical forest smack dab in the middle that consisted about nearly 2.5/4 of the island. Fox is stuck in a huge rut at the moment, and help seems far away at the moment.

What would Fox do now?

Fox decided to walk along the shoreline since he could find something useful during while being stuck in this predicament and standing around won't do anything helpful. He then started trekking down the shoreline, leaving the wrecked Arwing behind. After walking on the sandy shores for awhile, he tried his communicator watch again, hoping for a connection to his crew. "Slippy? Do you come in?" Yet like last time the only answer was static. Fox only grunted in frustration at the fact and continued on. About half an hour walking in the hot sun, it felt fatigue like was going to overtake him as he panted. He then stopped for awhile, but in the sand he spotted something. He saw something shimmering in the sun a few feet from him. He went to the shiny object and found...

What did he found?

12513222221.content:
There was something glittering in the sand which looked like a silver ring. Fox approached the metallic objects and picked it up. He then examined it thoroughly. The silver ring had some weird text around the outside. He thought how weird on a presumably deserted island he would fine a neatly forged ring. As he stared at the ring that sat on the palm of his hand or paw, it seemed like it had glowed a bit, but thought it was his eyes playing tricks or a trick from the sun. However, he felt some kind of invisible pull to the ring, like becoming under some kind of enticing trance to it. He felt like wearing it, and why not? It seemed harmless enough, despite its mysterious and unknown origins. He took the ring and slid it onto his ring finger. Though a bit snug, it fitted just right! Suddenly, he felt a growing warmth throughout his body. As it was hot enough with the sun beating down on him, the extra heated sensation made it feel necessary to take his clothes off, but just ignored it and then continued on his way along the beach.

What happens next?

He walked towards the sea cliff nearby, and he walked into the cave to see how deep it'll go. Surprisingly, the cave was pretty deep as he traveled about 45 minutes into it. He then reached a big room, and what was in there surprised him. In the middle of room was......

The water looked very clean that it looked like it hasn't been touched by any animal or affected by nature itself. Also, he was able to see his reflection clearly. Though he did have a strange feeling whenever he gets near the water. An enticing feeling that Fox felt like taking off his clothes and take a dip in it right now!

However, he tried to shake off his thoughts and wanted to explore more of the island. Though he did felt a little parched at the moment and though of taking a drink before leaving yet the the enticing feeling came back stronger than ever telling him to swim in it.

In the center of the room was a huge stone column that connected the cave floor to the ceiling. It was well carved and handcrafted as the roughness of stone seemed nonexistent from its smooth base and shaft. What was odd about the column was the shaft.There was some weird markings all around it. It looked like some kind of runes or alien language.

Fox took a closer look at the markings. "What could this mean?" he said to himself. Then he placed his hand/paw on the column, and then abruptly, the runes on the column began to glow. He was in total panic as he tried to get his hand off the column, but it was stuck. Next, he felt a powerful sensation raced through his body. After a few minutes, the glowing faded and the flow of energy ceased. He was able to remove his hand of the thing and backed away from it.

He breathed heavily while still in shock. "What the heck just happened?!' he yelled. He felt tingling all over his body after receiving such energy.

What happens next?

15532222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Fox let out a heavy sigh of relief and relaxation as he sat down beneath a pine with a sea of its tree brethren behind it.

Spending time on Sauria for his day off since missions and mercenary work were scarce at the moment was a good idea indeed!

On a cliff that overlooked Thorn Tail Hollow, surrounded with stony ruins, he could see the spot where he parked his Arwing, the resident dinosaurs or EarthWalkers as they called themselves were either resting beneath the shades of trees or grazing on the grass and the Warpstone just mingling with Tricky and her mother. All underneath a fine sunny day.

With Andross defeated and Star Wolf not being heard from for a long time, everything seems to be fine thus far.

Letting out another sigh of satisfaction, he put his folded hands behind his head as he prepared to take a nap. It wasn’t long until sleep had taken hold on him. After a few minutes of deep slumber, something strange started to happen.
15532222222222222222222222222222221.title: Wonderful Beginnings

155322222222222222222222222222222211.content:
Then the curious thing began to happen, Fox was shrinking out of his clothes! Inch by inch, his body decreased in height, making his clothes becoming looser and him looking like a toddler playing dress up. Then he became the size of a six inch action figure with his clothes acting like a giant blanket and it was when he stirred in his oversize attire that something was way off, feeling covered but naked.

He awoke to discover his small yet big situation and in a bit of a panic he crawled out of the opening of his shirt to see everything more gargantuan than before, where the surrounding trees looked as tall as the skyscrapers in Corneria City. He looked down, blushing and noticing and covered his furred sheath in reflex.

"Wh-what happened to me?! How did-?!"

"I'm late! I'm late for an important date!" said a familiar rabbit figure dressed in a purple Victorian suit and hat that hopped passed the fox.

"Pe-Peppy!?" he shouted in confusion at the sight of his fellow pilot who ran to the nearest tree and jumped into a hole at its base.

Fox followed suit to catch him for some answers. He got into the hole which was around a four feet drop by his size. It was a straight shot down the the dark tunnel, it seemed that the hare was out of sight but he could still hear his footsteps. Fox tried to catch up to him only to come across a new problem, a fork in a road that branches into three directions: left, center and right. He had to choose fast or else he'll lose him.

Which way did he go?

15532222222222222222222222222222221122.content:
He went down the right path choosing, any which way to catch up to the hare whose voice was becoming distant and inaudible.

‘Crud, I’m gonna lose him. But rather get out of here first.’ He thought.

After going in further, the tunnel began to shrink as the ceiling became lower and lower. Soon, he had to crouch to press on, then further he had to crawl.

“Ugh, maybe I should head back and take a-AAAH!”

The ground beneath Fox gave way and he fell through. But he fell like a feather, slowly and gracefully. Odder still were the things that he saw as he fell like bookshelves, vases with flowers in them, globes and other common household objects.

The fall didn't last too long as he landed on a red cushion, the hole above gone and replaced with a black and white checker pattern ceiling.

He found himself in room with black and white checker pattern floor and ceilings and baby blue colored walls. In front of him and center in the room was a glass table with two vials of liquid, one blue and one red. Beyond the table on the opposite wall, there was a decorative door about one foot tall.

"Now where am I?" he said as he stood up. He seemed to be back to normal size so to speak.

"I'm late! I'm late! I'm terribly terribly late!"

Peppy seemed to appeared out of nowhere to Fox's surprise, still small as before, and went through the door. Fox went over to the door and looked around the room, realizing that it's the only exit. Great, he was stuck here. Then, he looked over at the vials of liquid on the table and went over to them. Without any other options available, drinking one of the vials seemed to be the only way forward.

Which vial did he drink?
15532222222222222222222222222222221122.title: Right

1553222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
“*Yawn….”

The leader of Star Fox woke up after a long nap in his navy blue boxers and white tank top, pushing off some of the sheets.

He groggily rubbed his eyes as they looked around the room. Across his bed on the other side of the room, a shelf of books, disc and other things was built into the white wall. Above that was a TV screen monitor with a receiver power box attached to it. The hologram monitor computer system nestled an even distance between the foot of the bed and the book shelf. To the right of the bed was a black dresser drawer with five shelves which was next to a sliding closet filled with space suits and other kinds of attire. A small hallway like space concealed a bathroom near the bedroom door.

He got out of bed, making the sheets droop to the floor. He yawned again as he stretched. He hadn’t slept that good since he was a kit. Going towards the drawer, he pulled out a pair of dark blue gym shorts from the top shelf and put it on. He went over to the computer and press a few buttons on the keyboard for the holographic flat green screen to come on, clicking on some icons and scrolling down.

“It’s been about 4 days and still no new missions from the General. Starting to get boring around here.” He said with sigh. After their last mission had them to travel very far away for nearly a week to some far off distant planet, the trip back home felt longer than the other way around.

Soon, the growling of his stomach was heard. It was time to eat.

After putting on some slippers, he headed out the door into the white hallway and brown tiled flooring and went towards the mess hall. He opened the stainless steel fridge and grabbed some food items to make a sandwich. It wasn’t long until he finished and felt full. However, something about how silent it has been bothering him slightly and he hadn’t seen much of anyone lately.

He went to the front of the Great Fox towards the bridge to check if Peppy and Slippy were still piloting.

“Slippy? Peppy?” he said as he entered the bridge, only to meet with silence.

The hare and frog wasn’t there as the 3 control panels, ones on the left, right and front, were unmanned and all the seats empty. He went over to the front to see that the ship was engaged in autopilot mode.

‘Maybe they’re back in their rooms?’ he thought. He was heading back anyway.

Once he had gotten back into the hallway of rooms, eeriness crept within him. Again, it felt oddly too silent for the ship even with the usual electronic humming within the wall wiring. He decided to check up on them, first one being Krystal.

He went to the door to the right next door to his. He pounded on it very hard.

“Krystal? Are you in there?” he loudly said.

Silence only responded. He tried again but louder, only getting the same response. Could she be in the bathroom? No, if so, he would at least hear some kind of running water whether from the toilet or the shower. Fox pondered for a while and decided to barge in to see what was going on. He punched in a series of numbers on the control panel on the wall right next to the door. Then the door slid opened and he went inside.

The room was almost the same as his as were the rest of the other ones. The few exceptions being a dresser with a vanity mirror that settled on top, a rack that held her staff and a shelf filled with some tribal books. Also, there were plenty of fem-care and items in the bathroom. Yet no sign of Krystal anywhere. Odd as he didn’t encounter her during his trip to the kitchen and bridge and back.

“Where could she be?” Fox puzzled.

He left her room to check up on Falco’s room which was next door his from the other side. He repeated the same actions as he did with Krystal; he banged on the door and called out his name and overrides the door to see if he was inside. It yielded to the same result of it being completely empty.

Rinse, lather and repeat the same actions to his other crew members’ rooms.

“They’re not in their rooms. Maybe they’re in the lower decks?” he tried to reason.

He went down to the end of the hallway where the stairwell was that led further down the ship. There contained a few areas/rooms: Slippy’s science lab, the engine room, a gym (by Falco’s request), a rations and cargo room, and the Arwing hangar. He went to check them all.

In the lab? No.

In the engine room? Nada.

In the gym? Nope.

Rations and cargo room? Nothing.

The Arwing hangar was just left. He already searched every nook and cranny of the spaceship and he hoped that they were there. He disengaged the door as it slid opened. He discovered that…
1553222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: A Crew of One

choices: He goes with the idea of going nude
He refuses the idea of going nude
1553222222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
All the Arwings were present and accounted for, but his friends were yet to be found.

“Where are they?” he said aloud and started to think on it.

He had checked nearly every place now only to come up to a dead end here. The question repeated again in his head as he paced around the hangar. Panic and fear slightly took hold when he thought that they could have been sucked into space accidentally.

‘No…no, that can’t be. If that were true, the ship would have rumbled slightly due to the hatch door to space opening as well as the warning signal that goes along with it that usually resounds in most of the ship.’

After doing a second sweep of the ship and yielding no results, he went back to his room, stumped onto what to do next. He could figure out an explanation for all this, but again what can he do if he does found one? He was still worried about the others but what can he do to bring them back? The ship is still days from Corneria and communications will be down for the time being too. There weren’t any known habitable planets to stop by either and wandering aimlessly in space in his Arwing looking his friends was out of the question and nonsensical. He was stuck sailing supposedly solo in space for now.

As he laid there pondering, an odd peculiar stray thought entered his head.

‘If the crew is gone and you’re alone for now, why not go around the ship naked?’

Fox just shook his head. Where did that thought come from? Sure, there wasn’t much he can do and had other things in mind, but something like that seemed way too absurd. Not to mention the embarrassment of him getting caught if his friends popped up out of the blue and question his action. However, that thought still persisted and nagged in his mind and slowly he became curious about it and the more he thought the more it became enticing.

What does he do?
1553222222222222222222222222222222222222.title: All Arwings Present, All Friends Absent
